title: Paul's Conversion
summary: Saul encounters Jesus on the road to Damascus and is converted.

title: Paul Preaches in Damascus
summary: After his conversion, Paul immediately begins proclaiming Jesus in the synagogues.

title: Paul and Barnabas sent from Antioch
summary: Leaders in Antioch commission Paul and Barnabas for the first journey.

title: Preaching in Salamis Synagogues
summary: Paul and Barnabas proclaim the word of God in the synagogues of Salamis.

title: Elymas the Sorcerer Blinded
summary: Paul confronts Elymas, who is then temporarily blinded, leading to the proconsul's belief.

title: John Mark Departs at Perga
summary: John Mark leaves Paul and Barnabas and returns to Jerusalem.

title: Paul's Sermon in Pisidian Antioch
summary: Paul preaches a powerful sermon, leading to many conversions and opposition from Jews.

title: Opposition in Iconium
summary: Paul and Barnabas face a plot to stone them and flee to Lystra and Derbe.

title: Healing of Lame Man in Lystra
summary: Paul heals a lame man, leading to the crowd attempting to worship them, and then stoning Paul.

title: Making Disciples in Derbe
summary: Paul and Barnabas preach the gospel and make many disciples in Derbe.

title: Jerusalem Council
summary: A council is held to discuss whether Gentiles need to be circumcised to be saved.

title: Paul and Silas Depart for Second Journey
summary: Paul and Barnabas separate, and Paul chooses Silas for his second missionary journey.

title: Timothy Joins Paul in Lystra
summary: Paul meets Timothy and circumcises him for the sake of the Jews in the region.

title: Macedonian Call at Troas
summary: Paul has a vision of a man from Macedonia pleading for help, leading them to cross into Europe.

title: Lydia's Conversion in Philippi
summary: Lydia, a seller of purple cloth, is converted and opens her home to Paul and his companions.

title: Philippian Jailer Converted
summary: Paul and Silas are imprisoned, an earthquake opens the prison doors, and the jailer and his household are converted.

title: Opposition in Thessalonica
summary: Paul preaches in the synagogue, but a mob forms, forcing Paul and Silas to leave.

title: Noble-minded Bereans
summary: The Jews in Berea eagerly examine the Scriptures daily to verify Paul's teachings.

title: Paul on Mars Hill in Athens
summary: Paul preaches to the Areopagus about the unknown god.

title: Paul Meets Aquila and Priscilla in Corinth
summary: Paul lives and works with Aquila and Priscilla, and preaches in Corinth.

title: Gallio Dismisses Case in Corinth
summary: Gallio, the proconsul, refuses to judge a dispute about Jewish law.

title: Paul in Ephesus
summary: Paul teaches disciples about the Holy Spirit and performs many miracles.

title: Riot in Ephesus
summary: Demetrius, a silversmith, incites a riot against Paul due to the decline in idol sales.

title: Paul Imprisoned in Caesarea
summary: Paul is transferred to Caesarea for his safety and held under house arrest.

title: Paul Before Festus
summary: Festus hears Paul's case, and Paul appeals to Caesar.

title: Paul Before Agrippa
summary: Paul defends himself before King Agrippa, recounting his conversion and ministry.

title: Shipwreck on Malta
summary: Paul's ship is wrecked on the island of Malta.

title: Viper Bite on Malta
summary: Paul is bitten by a viper but suffers no harm, leading the islanders to believe he is a god.

title: Paul Under House Arrest in Rome
summary: Paul preaches the kingdom of God and teaches about the Lord Jesus Christ with all boldness and without hindrance.
